channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Poroshenko Sworn In as President of Strife-Torn Ukraine
item.description: Mr. Poroshenko was sworn in amid a continuing separatist insurrection in eastern Ukraine by pro-Russian fighters.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

item.title: Obama and Putin Meet Briefly at D-Day Event
item.description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia met with Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine, and Mr. Putin also had an informal conversation with President Obama at the D-Day commemoration ceremony in France.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: President-elect Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine, on Friday passed President Vladimir V. Putin at a D-Day event in France.

item.title: Andrei N. Mironov, Soviet-Era Political Prisoner and Activist, Dies at 60
item.description: Mr. Mironov caught on early to the absurdities of Soviet life and later became active in the samizdat movement.
item.dc:creator: By SOPHIA KISHKOVSKY
item.media:description: An arrangement at a memorial service in Moscow for Andrei N. Mironov.

item.title: World Briefing: Iraq: Attacks Kill at Least 27 People
item.description: Two car bombings against members of an ethnic minority in northern Iraq and militant attacks on Iraqi soldiers and police officers killed at least 27 people on Friday, Iraqi officials said.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Spain: Citizenship Plan for Sephardic Jews
item.description: Spain’s cabinet on Friday approved a bill allowing descendants of Jews forced into exile centuries ago the right to dual citizenship.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Egyptian Election Law Helps to Block Opposition
item.description: The new law allows authorities to bar the candidacy of supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood, the Islamist group that dominated Egypt’s free elections after the 2011 uprising.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: U.N. Chief Picks Jordanian Prince for Rights Post
item.description: Prince Zeid Ra’ad Zeid al-Hussein, Jordan’s ambassador to the United Nations, was nominated to replace Navi Pillay as high commissioner for human rights.
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Obama Nominates Ambassadors to France and Ireland
item.description: Jane D. Hartley, chief executive officer of an economic consulting firm, will serve in France, and Kevin F. O’Malley, a lawyer, will fill a long-vacant post in Ireland.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Kevin O’Malley, a St. Louis-based lawyer, was nominated to be ambassador to Ireland.

item.title: Pakistan Suspends License of Leading News Channel
item.description: The 15-day suspension of Geo is seen as a sign of growing tensions between the country’s civilian and military leaders.
item.dc:creator: By DECLAN WALSH
item.media:description: A Pakistani viewer in Islamabad looks at a television screen flashing a notice suspending Geo News.

item.title: Internet Giants Erect Barriers to Spy Agencies
item.description: Internet companies like Google and Facebook are working to keep governments and especially their spy agencies out of their servers after revelations from Edward J. Snowden that they had been invaded.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
item.media:description: Google servers in Douglas County, Ga. The company is encrypting more data as it moves between servers.

item.title: P.O.W. Deal Gives Qatar a Victory, and a New Test
item.description: There is much on the line for Qatar, which has wagered its already weakened reputation on keeping the Taliban militants out of sight and under control.
item.dc:creator: By ROD NORDLAND and MARK MAZZETTI
item.media:description: Mohammad Nabi Omari, one of the Taliban militants released in the exchange for Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, in Qatar on Sunday.

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: Drought Adds to Woes, U.N. Says
item.description: The supply of safe water in Syria is now one-third of the level it was before March 2011 when the civil war began, Unicef officials said.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: World Briefing: India: Officers Convicted in Man’s Death
item.description: Seventeen police officers were convicted of kidnapping and killing a man, 22, and could face the death penalty when they are sentenced on Monday, Indian officials said.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Prayer Meeting Shows Pope’s Larger Vision
item.description: Pope Francis’s prayer meeting on Sunday with the Israeli and Palestinian presidents shows how he is trying to position the Vatican as an independent, global diplomatic player.
item.dc:creator: By JIM YARDLEY

item.title: Facebook Under Fire for Temporarily Blocking Pages in Pakistan
item.description: Citing pressure from the Pakistani government, Facebook said it blocked left-wing political pages and a popular rock band, Laal, whose members spoke out against Taliban.
item.dc:creator: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD

item.title: Suspect Arrested in Killing of Three Mounties in New Brunswick
item.description: Justin Bourque is accused of shooting the police officers in what witnesses called an ambush in Moncton.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN

item.title: In Britain, Child’s Weight Leads to Parents’ Arrest
item.description: The police called it a rare step when they arrested the parents of a 210-pound, 11-year-old boy on suspicion of neglect and child cruelty.
item.dc:creator: By KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

item.title: Susan Rice Affirms View That P.O.W. Served With ‘Honor’
item.description: The national security adviser, Susan E. Rice, insisted that she had been right to assert that Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl served with “honor and distinction.”
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER

item.title: World Briefing: Austrian Journalist Convicted in Holocaust Restitution Case Vows to Appeal
item.description: Stephan Templ, accused of defrauding the state by omitting a relative from a restitution claim for property looted by the Nazis in 1939, was sentenced to one year in prison.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Survivor of Attack on Jewish Museum in Brussels Dies
item.description: The death of Alexandre Strens, 24, who was working as a receptionist at the museum at the time of the attack, raises the death toll to four.
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SAYARE

item.title: State Department Ramps Up Efforts Against Boko Haram
item.description: State Department officials acknowledged that their efforts to directly challenge Boko Haram could prove challenging in a region racked by massacres, bombings and shootings.
item.dc:creator: By RON NIXON
item.media:description: A mother of one of the Nigerian girls kidnapped by the extremist group Boko Haram, during a news conference in Lagos on Friday.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: June 6
item.description: Exiled Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama spoke to school and college students in Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: The Dalai Lama, exiled Tibetan spiritual leader, speaking on the final day of his annual teaching schedule for Tibetan school and college students in Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh.

item.title: North Korea Detains 3rd American in New Threat to Relations With U.S.
item.description: The man, a resident of suburban Dayton, Ohio, was accused of unspecified illegal acts while visiting the country as a tourist.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Saudi Arabia and Iran Reach Out Tentatively
item.description: With the Persian Gulf region still in tumult, there have been surprising signs that Tehran and Riyadh are looking to temper their destructive rivalry.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: Foreign ministers attended the Gulf Cooperation Council, a six-nation regional coalition, in Riyadh last week.

item.title: D-Day’s Wheels Roll Again
item.description: Thousands of military enthusiasts in trucks, jeeps and other Army vehicles converged on Normandy, France, to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day.
item.category: Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corp
item.dc:creator: By AARON ROBINSON
